[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: Capability] [Permission escalation] Can an attacker with Capability::Read permission exploit trait method implementations to gain Capability::Write or Capability::Export through method chaining or type coercion? (Critical)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: crypto_kv_storage] [Private key versioning] Does export_private_key_for_version() properly validate that the requested version exists before returning a key, or can an attacker cause undefined behavior by requesting non-existent versions? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Function: from_base64() + Module: crypto_storage] [Deserialization of trusted data] When deserializing Ed25519PrivateKey from base64, is there cryptographic validation that the deserialized key is mathematically valid, or can corrupted keys cause consensus failures? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: namespaced + vault] [Namespace separator confusion] Can differences between NAMESPACE_SEPARATOR ('/') and TRANSIT_NAMESPACE_SEPARATOR ('__') in Vault create access control bypasses where namespaced keys are accessible without proper authorization? (Critical)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: on_disk] [Atomic write failure] Does OnDiskStorage's write() method using TempPath properly handle crashes or power failures during fs::rename(), or can interrupted writes corrupt validator consensus keys? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: Storage enum] [Enum exhaustiveness] Does the Storage enum exhaustively cover all possible storage backends, or can an attacker exploit pattern matching exhaustiveness to cause panics during runtime storage operations? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: storage] [Box<Storage> recursion] Does the NamespacedStorage(Namespaced<Box<Storage>>) variant allow unbounded recursion that could cause stack overflow when deeply nested namespaces are accessed? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: KVStorage trait] [Trait object safety] Are all KVStorage methods object-safe, or can dynamic dispatch through trait objects cause undefined behavior when storage backends are switched at runtime? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: crypto_kv_storage] [Trait implementation consistency] Does CryptoKVStorage's blanket implementation of CryptoStorage for all T: CryptoKVStorage ensure consistent security properties across all storage backends? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Function: to_base64() + serde] [Serialization format pinning] Does to_base64() guarantee stable serialization format across Rust/serde versions, or can format changes cause validators to generate different signatures for the same data after upgrades? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Function: from_base64() + Error propagation] [Error type confusion] Does from_base64() map all deserialization errors to Error::SerializationError consistently, or can specific error types leak information about what keys exist in storage? (Low)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: kv_storage + GetResponse] [Timestamp overflow] Can the last_update field (u64) in GetResponse overflow if the system clock is set to far future dates, causing incorrect key expiration or rotation logic? (Low)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Function: to_base64()] [Newline injection] Does base64::encode() in to_base64() produce single-line output without newlines, or can newline characters in serialized data break parsing of key storage formats? (Low)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: tests] [Test isolation] Are tests in the #[cfg(test)] mod tests properly isolated to prevent test code from leaking into production builds where it could expose key management functions? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Modules: in_memory + on_disk] [Testing-only storage in production] Do InMemoryStorage and OnDiskStorage have sufficient warnings and guards to prevent their use in production validator deployments where they don't provide adequate security? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: kv_storage] [Reset function exposure] Is the reset_and_clear() method properly guarded by #[cfg(any(test, feature = 'testing'))] across all KVStorage implementations to prevent accidental production exposure? (Critical)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Line 6: use aptos_crypto::ed25519] [Cryptographic library trust] Does the re-exported Ed25519 implementation from aptos_crypto undergo regular security audits, and are there checks to prevent downgrade attacks to weaker signature schemes? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Line 39: base64::encode] [Base64 library choice] Does the base64 library used for serialization have known vulnerabilities or side-channel issues that could affect cryptographic key encoding/decoding? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: vault] [Vault client dependency] Does aptos_vault_client properly validate TLS certificates when connecting to Vault servers to prevent MITM attacks on consensus key retrieval? (Critical)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: error] [Error conversion safety] Do the From<T> implementations for Error properly sanitize sensitive information from underlying errors (io::Error, serde_json::Error) before propagating them? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: CryptoStorage::rotate_key()] [Rotation atomicity] Does rotate_key() implementation ensure that the previous key is stored before the new key is activated, preventing key loss if the operation is interrupted? (Critical)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: crypto_kv_storage] [Previous version naming] Is the get_previous_version_name() function's naming scheme ('{name}_previous') collision-resistant, or can an attacker create keys that collide with versioned key names? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Re-export: CryptoStorage::get_public_key_previous_version()] [Version retention policy] Does the storage system enforce a maximum of 2 key versions as documented, or can unbounded version history cause storage exhaustion attacks? (Medium)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: vault] [Vault key trimming] Does VaultStorage's trim_key_versions() method coordinate with other validators to ensure old keys aren't deleted while they're still needed for signature verification? (High)

[File: secure/storage/src/lib.rs] [Module: in_memory + concurrency] [HashMap concurrent access] Does InMemoryStorage using HashMap require external synchronization (Arc<RwLock<>>), or can concurrent access from multiple threads cause data races during key operations? (Critical)
